definition: A legislative body consisting of elected representatives who debate and make decisions on laws and policies, typically representing the interests of the citizens. It is the central institution of democratic governance in many countries, responsible for enacting legislation and overseeing the government's activities.

examples.german: Das Parlament hat heute eine wichtige Entscheidung getroffen.
examples.english: The parliament made an important decision today.

examples.german: Die Abgeordneten diskutieren im Parlament über das neue Gesetz.
examples.english: The members of parliament are discussing the new law in the parliament.

examples.german: Das Parlament besteht aus verschiedenen politischen Parteien.
examples.english: The parliament consists of different political parties.

examples.german: Der Präsident des Parlaments eröffnet die Sitzung.
examples.english: The president of the parliament opens the session.

examples.german: Die Opposition kritisiert die Entscheidungen des Parlaments.
examples.english: The opposition criticizes the decisions of the parliament.
